message.content:
cs.LG, cs.IT, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the problem of predicting the next observation given a sequence of past observations, which is a common problem in machine learning and data science. The paper proposes a simple algorithm that achieves good prediction accuracy based on a short memory of the past observations and some simple summary statistics. This suggests that the paper is likely to be relevant to the sub-category of machine learning (cs.LG) and information theory (cs.IT), which deal with the theory and practice of learning from data and information processing, respectively. The paper also discusses the use of Markov models and Hidden Markov Models (HMMs) for prediction, which are common models in artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and data science (cs.DS). Finally, the paper discusses the computational complexity of learning the Markov model and the hardness of certain computational problems, which suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the sub-category of computational complexity (cs.SI).
